oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Brass container
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The top of this container is labeled "The Holmes Booth & Haydens Co., Manufacturers New York" and "Round Heads". It features a star with a 4 inside it. This container likely held brass fasteners. Included with the container is a note that says "Found on; Petersburg Battle field" and "found in 1931." Bullets were also found with the tin. The Holmes, Booth & Haydens company began in 1853 in Connecticut & was engaged in casting, rolling, and drawing brass and copper.
